intro: Hedstromia, commonly known as the goldenrods, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to North America and are characterized by their showy, yellow or orange inflorescences. Hedstromia species typically grow in moist or wet environments, such as marshes and along stream banks. They have lance-shaped leaves and are often used in landscaping for their ornamental value. The genus includes several species, with Hedstromia triquetra being one of the most well-known.
